description:
It is a note-taking libreware that fits perfectly to GNOME. It also has nice support for languages that are written in other scripts than the Latin script (i.e., Arabic.)

With the community's contributions, it could be something even more powerful and the mainstream note-taking application for GNOME.

The app is pretty easy to use and looks good. 
Therea are a couple of bugs I faced: I was not able to delete notebooks and there's a missing image resource for the Format button when taking notes.
summary: Nice app with couple of small bugs

description:
Perfectly designed to fit in with the GNOME desktop environment. It's easy to use, intuitive, and fully-featured. It even has a built-in markdown cheatsheet for a reminder on how to use it to format your text.

It doesn't sync with cloud providers like how Iotas does with Nextcloud Notes. However, you can change the directory where your notebooks are saved. So you could keep all your notebooks in a folder on your computer that gets synced to the cloud if you wanted to keep a backup copy.

I'd love to see spell check added to the app in future. Also, text overflows horizontally when the app window is made narrow, so you'll probably want to use it maximised. Otherwise, really wonderful work!
summary: The most beautiful note-taking app on Linux
